author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I think I got the prysm-ethereumjs node stuck again

author: g11tech
content: no worries, we are in processing of making etheruemjs more robust as we seem to have some issues in dealing with head reorgs as well as restarting the backfill sync if needed

author: g11tech
content: currently ethereumjs restarts gets it moving again

author: barnabasbusa
content: This one is lighthouse-reth, so indeed it seems like a common reth issue.

author: marcinds
content: I'm spamming devnet-9 with 6-blob txs. As far 8k sent out of 16k planned

author: marekm3498
content: It broke many client pairs again!

author: marcinds
content: Yeah and nethermind is missing many slots again. Debugging

author: marcinds
content: We found and fixed serious bug in block building, causing thousands of unneeded db reads on some block production attempts and at the end causing many missed slots. It was affecting the node significantly only with high amount of heavy txs in db, so it was clearly visible in current spamming experiment. After updating nethermind nodes on devnet-9 to new version, block production seems perfectly fine. I will continue experiment with sending 6-blob txs, maybe we will find some other issues

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: We added an evil version of geth to teku-geth-1, validator 780 to 880. So there will be a lot of bad blocks originating from that

author: marekm3498
content:
Heads up, looks like we've just had missing slots from all clients
It could be related to blob spamming. 

oh but teku-geth is expected, but still there are missing slots with nimbus-geth, lodestar-geth and prysm-geth
